file_content.text: The med droids tell me the boys are responding well to treatment.
Medic!
Don't worry. You're safe now. We'll give you something to help you sleep.
You did good. Myahh says that's all that's left alive.
If it wasn't for you, every one of those men would have turned rakghoul. I wish I could have been there!
It was a fierce battle, but mere beasts cannot stand against the Force.
The righteous always triumph.
I'd give my left lung to see one of your kind in action.
I felt their anguish and sought them out in the thick of the rakghoul nests.
They have suffered terribly.
We're... lucky to have you.
When those boys wake up, I'll tell them a real Jedi Master thought their lives were worth saving.
Smoking ghoul corpses left and right. Tell those scouts they've earned their retirement.
You'd have loved it.
Ah, to be ten years younger....
It'd have been nice to have an extra blaster or two for the good guys.
I wish you could have, too.
Well, you've put my men to shame. Ever consider a career in military service?
Do you think those scouts will ever recover?
What happens to them now?
Not like they used to be, but they'll get the best care we can give.
You do at that. I thought you'd maybe bring back one, but you've got half the crew here. Take this with my thanks.
Soon as those boys pass quarantine, we'll get them to a real hospital.
Whatever they need, it's theirs on the Republic's tab. And I'll tell them it's all thanks to you.
I hope you find some of those men. I really do.
Ah, I'd heard you were in our airspace, Lieutenant. Welcome to the last frontier.
Master Jedi! Honored to have you. Nice to see some of your order out of the temple and in the world again.
Ah, an intrepid explorer. Good to see there's still folks in the Republic who aren't scared away from our little colony.
Th--they're coming! At the door--the door! We have to get out! Alert the base! Everyone needs to evacuate.
Is the base under attack? What's going on?
Who's coming?
Who are you?
You don't seem terribly concerned.
Is this guy for real?
That's Myahh, former first lieutenant of the Endar Rebirth, the first scout vessel sent here to evaluate the possibility of recolonization.
Ship disappeared five years ago. Then three days ago, Myahh comes staggering out of one of the collapsed buildings outside the base.
He lived out there, no weapons but what he made from salvage, holding his own against the rakghouls, all that time.
He made a great sacrifice for the Republic.
A credit to our soldiers.
Him and others. Those who've lost their lives and those still barely holding onto them.
When pressed beyond endurance, a man can find great reserves within.
He has a strong will.
Those boys know they're part of the battle to keep the Sith out of our galaxy. They're hard to keep down.
His body lives, but his mind has paid the price.
A costly victory.
He has some lucid moments... it's an ugly life left to him now.
Okay, I'll stop complaining about the lack of cantinas here.
Puts me to shame.
These are good Republic men. They deserve to know that, as long as they're alive, we'll come for them.
That's amazing.
We breed our boys tough.
A fascinating story. I'm sure I'll read how it ends.
I should go.
Well, if your sympathies are lacking, how about your sense of adventure?
Myahh swears there are other survivors trapped in those ruins, tormented by rakghouls.
Upper brass, sitting on Ord Mantell, say it's too dangerous to send in a rescue unit, so those boys'll die to spare some others the risk of it.
Five years... those soldiers should not be left to suffer another day.
So you need someone to help?
I was hoping you'd jump on the chance. I'd have been right there with you back when I had no stripes to wear.
Are the brass right, or are they jumping at shadows?
How dangerous?
No, they've got it right. We go in there, we'll lose three men for every one we save.
Just beyond the base, thickest part of the city collapsed in on itself. Rakghouls everywhere, tunnels so tight there's nowhere to run.
But I say, to deep space with logic! These good Republic boys deserve better! Up for a little adventure?
If it was me, I'd want to know the Republic would come after me.
I'll do it.
Sounds risky. Any payoff?
I can't make the offer official, but I'll personally give you the death benefit for each one you bring back alive.
Y--you'll help? They're in the ruins. The city... it's all collapsed. Y--you can't see the ghouls, just the yellow eyes... and the smell....
Anyone you find, bring them here. We'll make sure they finish their days in comfort.
Sorry. [Refuse quest]
N--no one will come. We'll be out there forever. Forever....
If I were in your shoes, I'd have jumped at the opportunity.
Your problem. [Refuse quest]
I was hoping for better. I've heard what you've faced, and you might be one of the few on this wretched hole who could risk it.
No man wants to walk into battle knowing he'll die a statistic.
So few soldiers these days who really embrace the frontier....
There wasn't much fun to miss.
Can't you do better than that?
